item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description:
"Do you find it easy to get drunk on words?"
"So easy that, to tell you the truth, I am seldom perfectly sober." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description: "Time and trouble will tame an advanced young woman, but an advanced old woman is uncontrollable by any earthly force." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is useless to meet revenge with revenge; it will heal nothing." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Esther De Waal
item.description: "Stability says there must be no evasion; instead attend to the real, to the real necessity however uncomfortable that might be. Stability brings us from a feeling of alienation, perhaps from the escape into fantasy and daydreaming, into the state of reality. It will not allow us to evade the inner truth of whatever it is that we have to do, however dreary and boring and apparently unfruitful that may seem. It involves listening...to the particular demands of whatever this task and this moment in time is asking; no more and no less." -- Esther De Waal

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by David Steindl-Rast
item.description: "Look closely and you will find that people are happy because they are grateful. The opposite of gratefulness is just taking everything for granted. " -- David Steindl-Rast

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Don't be seduced into thinking that that which does not make a profit is without value." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Child, child, do you not see? For each of us comes a time when we must be more than what we are." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Leonard Woolf
item.description: "Anyone can be a barbarian; it requires a terrible effort to remain a civilized man." -- Leonard Woolf

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Compassion is the basis of morality." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "There is no immortality that is not built on friendship and work done with care. All the secrets in the world worth knowing are hiding in plain sight. It takes forty-one seconds to climb a ladder three stories tall. It's not easy to imagine the year 3012, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't try. We have new capabilities nowâ€”strange powers we're still getting used to. The mountains are a message from Aldrag the Wyrm-Father. Your life must be an open city, with all sorts of ways to wander in." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Karen Floyd add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?" -- Ralph Ellison
